title: 5 possible trade targets for Patriots outside of Maxx Crosby, A.J. Brown
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Colts WR Michael Pittman Jr. is rumored as a trade candidate due to his salary cap number and team dynamics.
Bears WR DJ Moore may be on the trade block as Chicago considers asset rearrangement amid cap concerns.
Jaguars' OL Walker Little, struggling due to injury, could be an option for Patriots' offensive line improvement.

title: Jayson Tatum says he still doesn’t have a return date after participating in a 5-on-5 scrimmage at Celtics practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a 5-on-5 scrimmage but has no set return date from his Achilles injury.
Tatum practiced with the Celtics' G League affiliate, Maine Celtics, adding to speculation about his return.
Celtics' home game against the 76ers on March 1 raised anticipation for Tatum's possible return game.

title: NBC Sports broadcast teams rise to the occasion with Olympic calls from Milan Cortina
author: Chad Finn
bullets: NBC broadcasters Kenny Albert and A.J. Mleczko excel with their call during Team USA's gold-medal win in women's hockey.
The NBC team led by Terry Gannon, Tara Lipinski, and Johnny Weir uses silence effectively during Alysa Liu's figure skating routine.
Providence leads Super Bowl viewership ratings for Patriots vs. Seahawks game; Boston ranks third nationally.

title: Free MBTA bus program extended â€” for now
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Boston extends free rides on MBTA Routes 23, 28, and 29 to June, amid funding uncertainties.
The free bus pilot began in March 2022 using $8 million in federal pandemic relief funds.
Mayor Wu is exploring funding options with state officials for the program's long-term continuation.

title: Snow totals: See how much snow your town got
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Franklin County reported the highest snow total with 6.5 inches in Leyden from Friday night into Saturday morning.
Essex County saw significant snowfall with Haverhill recording up to 5 inches by Saturday morning.
The National Weather Service warns of a high-impact storm with blizzard conditions expected from Sunday night into Monday.

title: She’s running the 2026 Boston Marathon for the 2013 bombing victims
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Marissa LaRosa, from Canton, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon to honor the victims of the 2013 bombing.
LaRosa is inspired by her coworker Annie, who has completed the Boston Marathon 24 times, and serves as her coach.
The marathon, scheduled for April 20, 2026, represents both a personal achievement and a tribute to past tragedies for LaRosa.

title: NH man sentenced for using $1M in COVID relief funds to buy golf course
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Michael Kirouac, 38, of Pembroke, NH, sentenced to 15 months for using $1M in COVID relief funds to buy a golf course.
Kirouac obtained over $1M through Economic Injury Disaster Loans meant for pandemic relief and misused $600,000 for Angus Lea Golf Course.
Kirouac's fraudulent actions included securing loans for HK Manchester, HK Loudon, HK Pelham, and undisclosed sale of HK Hudson.

title: Man with 25-year record charged in high-end Boston shoplifting spree
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Peter Cutelis, 40, accused of multiple thefts at Back Bay stores, faces charges including larceny over $1,200 and drug possession.
Incidents involved thefts from Newbury Street's Lululemon and Ralph Lauren, with merchandise worth thousands of dollars allegedly stolen.
Cutelis, with a record since 2001, ordered to stay away from affected stores; held on additional fugitive charge from New Hampshire.

title: Red Sox will keep Roman Anthony in leadoff spot for 2026 season. What could rest of lineup look like?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Roman Anthony will be the Red Sox leadoff hitter for the 2026 season, as confirmed by manager Alex Cora.
Anthony excelled in the leadoff spot in 2025, achieving a .336 batting average and a 1.003 OPS as a leadoff hitter.
Anthony joins Willson Contreras, who will bat cleanup, in the confirmed lineup for Boston's 2026 season opener.

title: Margo Price talks AI, bro-country and meeting Joan Baez at the circus
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Margo Price, known for her 'outlaw country' style, emphasizes using music to voice social and political messages.
Price describes Joan Baez as a major influence and shared a memorable meeting during Baez's music and circus performance.
Price's husband, Jeremy Ivey, once lived in Massachusetts, adding a personal connection to her Boston performance.
